transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change its views. 
Many people are leaving the Church because its views are old.
The Church does not agree with gay marriage, abortion, or birth control. 
These are important issues today. The Church's views on these things make some people uncomfortable. 
People disagree with the Church on these topics. 
For example, if someone believes in abortion, they may not feel welcome in the Church. The same is true for people who support gay marriage. 
I think priests should be able to marry. Everyone else has a job and a family. 
The Church says priests are married to God, but I think they can be married to a person too.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should be able to marry who they want. I think it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot.  

It does not seem like being gay is a choice. Some people are born gay, just like some people are born straight. I do not think people should be punished for how they feel.

I do not think the government should be involved in who people marry. It is not a legal problem. It is a personal matter. People should be free to love who they want.

Many people believe that gay marriage should be legal. There are good reasons for this. Some people think that gay couples are bad for families. But this is not true. Gay couples are different from straight couples, but that does not mean they are bad. 

It is like having heads and tails. They are different, but both are important.

Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples. They should be able to share property and health care.

Many studies show that gay relationships are just as strong as straight relationships.  Gay couples are happy and want the same things as everyone else. 

Gay people are not asking to get married in a church. They want a legal marriage from the government. The government should not mix religion and law.

Some people say that gay marriage is wrong because of their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Gay couples should be treated the same as straight couples. They should have the right to adopt children. Some people worry about how children of gay couples will be treated. But children of gay couples are just like other children. They deserve love and support.

The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states. President Bush does not support gay marriage because of his religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Some people think that gay people are broken or damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association says that being gay is normal. People should listen to experts, not rumors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I see drugs all the time. Some drugs are illegal, but they can help people.  For example, oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets are illegal but we use them to help patients.

Just because something is illegal does not mean it is bad. Marijuana is illegal, but it can help people too. If we make it legal, people can use it safely and for medicine.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. Both can be bad if you use too much. But marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine.

We need to change how people think about marijuana. It is not a dangerous drug. If people see it as safe, they will use it responsibly.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I always wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there every week. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that is only thirty minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even to church. In summer, people come straight from the beach. The morning masses, where I used to dress up, are more casual now. People wear jeans and khakis.

Regarding the bad things that have happened with priests, I do not think the church could have stopped them. Some married men become pedophiles. It is about the person, not their marriage status. Priests choose to be priests. Other religions allow priests to be married. They could consider a different faith if they want to be married and practice their religion.

I believe pedophilia is a genetic issue. People are born that way. It is not caused by how they are raised. You cannot hide it through marriage.

If the church knew about these problems and covered them up, that is wrong. But I do not think they always knew.

I am not happy about the Iraq War. I think the Bush government lied to the people. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This is not true. 
The Bush government said the Iraq War was about September 11th. They said Saddam Hussein was involved. This is not true either.
Colin Powell, who led the presentation at the United Nations, now says he did not believe the evidence then. This is wrong. Lying to the people is a very serious problem. 

I think the Bush government does not care about the Constitution. They want more power. They wanted to go to war from the start.
Someone in the Bush government said this in a book after he left office. They wanted to fight Saddam Hussein because of his father. They also wanted to control more oil.

The Iraq War has gone on for too long. Leaving now could cause a civil war. More people would die. The United Nations and the United States are working with other countries to help Iraq. This may not be a good idea. Iraq will have less power.
The Iraqi government is weak. The Parliament does not work well. The Prime Minister has no control.  

Bad people still fight in Iraq. They want power. This makes the situation very complex.

I feel it is not a good idea for the war to continue. It is not a real war because Congress did not say it was. 

I think the main reason we are there is to show that America is strong. We have big guns and we are willing to use them.

But I do not think it is right to stay there and try to make Iraq like America. Iraq has its own culture. We should not try to change them.

Staying there is wasting our money and time. It is hurting the people in Iraq and it is making America look bad.

Many families have loved ones in Iraq. I understand why they want the war to end. But staying there is not the answer.

I think this war will go on for a long time. It is a bad situation.

I do not think it is right to make this act legal. I do not think a state should say it is legal. I think it is up to the churches. The Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear.

Trying to change this would go against what is already in the Constitution. If the government tries to make this act illegal, it would mean they are choosing one church's beliefs over another. Most Catholics and Christians are against this. 

The government should not tell churches what they can and cannot say is illegal or legal.  

Separation of church and state is important for religious freedom in the United States. Even though there was talk of an amendment, I think this would be wrong. It would go against what the Constitution already says. It would be one of the few amendments that restrict people instead of the government.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. I do not understand why someone would want to change the law. This person's reason for wanting an amendment is that it goes against his own beliefs as a Catholic.  He is choosing one religion over others. 

It is up to the churches to decide, not the president or the government. There is no good reason to have an amendment banning this. It will not affect the economy or anything else.

The war in Iraq is a difficult issue. I do not think the government was truthful with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before the invasion, the government tried to connect the war to the terrorist attacks on September 11th, 2001.  This made it seem like the two events were related, but they were not. The government used people's fear and anger after the attacks to start the war in 2003.

I am against war, especially when a country attacks first. The war in Iraq reminds me of the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes. Many American soldiers died in Iraq, and it is very sad.

The United States removed the Iraqi government and tried to create a democracy. This is similar to what happened in Vietnam, where the United States tried to remove Communists and support democracy. This is a very hard process. The government should have known it would be long and difficult.

The war in Iraq is not a clear victory.  No matter how many people support the United States, there will always be people who resist. It is hard to defeat people who are fighting in their own country.

The government should have planned better for what would happen after the war.  They were not prepared for the chaos and instability. We are still there today, almost at the end of 2006, and many American troops are still dying. 

The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful. It is not like that. It takes many years to build a new government and make it work. Our own country had a long struggle to become a democracy.

It is hard to decide what to do now. We have been there for so long. Can we just leave?  But many people in Iraq need our help.

The war has cost a lot of American lives. How much is too much to risk for a free Iraq?

Why are we only going to war in Iraq? Why not in other countries that need help? I think the real reason is oil. The United States needs oil, and Iraq has it.

Another reason for the war was that we thought Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. We never found them. But countries like North Korea have weapons of mass destruction, and we are not attacking them. I do not think the government is being honest.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it is a personal choice. Science shows it can be part of a person's nature, not just a choice they make. To deny people rights because of this is unfair.

I think the government should not decide who can marry. It is a personal matter between two people. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk their dogs and live their lives. 

I think it is wrong for the government to try to control who people love. Marriage is a personal choice.

I have read that being gay may be partly due to biology. It could be something a person is born with. This is different from things like family size or upbringing.

It seems unfair that gay couples face so much attention when they want to marry. Straight couples can marry privately, but gay couples' marriages are often in the news. Marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

The internet is open. Anything you put on it, people can see. As an RA, I have seen this. If you post about bad things, people will make judgments. If you talk about hurting people, someone will tell the school.

The school must act. They can't ignore a threat. But it's hard to know if something is a joke or serious.

In my school, a rumor started. Someone heard a student talk about bad things. The school found out who it was and looked at their Facebook. Some things on the page were worrisome. 

The student may have meant it as a joke, but it was serious in light of the rumor.

The internet is public. If you don't want people to see it, don't post it. You can't control how people react.

School officials shouldn't be friends with students on social media. That is wrong. 

But if a student tells the school about something concerning, the school has to act. They can't ignore it.

I think schools should not check phones, texts, or instant messages without a reason. It's a personal thing.

I think this war has gone on too long. At first, the goal was good. It was to help another country have democracy. But now I think we have lost sight of that goal. Maybe we are just fighting to show that we are strong. 

I also think the reason for the war may not have been fair. 
George Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein before.

If the goal was to help a country that did not have fair elections, then that is a good reason to fight. 

But I think the reason for the war has changed. It seems like we are fighting just to keep fighting.

I think we showed our strength in the first few months of the war. 

But the war has gone on for many years. I think it should end.

At some point, the other country will have to take care of itself. We have spent a lot of money on this war. We have problems here at home, like poverty. We should spend our money on these problems. 

We spend billions of dollars on the war. We need money for things like schools, roads, and healthcare.

We should not spend so much money on war.

I want to ask a question. Can someone tell me why someone's Myspace page was blocked?

It seems good that someone saw the information and stopped something bad from happening.  

But it is hard to know if it was right to look at someone's profile like that. Should someone be watching everyone's profiles to keep them safe? That seems unfair.

I use Facebook. I worry that bad people can see things about me. I saw a news story about a man who got a girl's information from her profile and talked to her. That is scary.

People can find a lot about you on Facebook. They can see your pictures, your friends, and even your schedule. It is hard to know how much to share.

I only accept friends I know. But it is still scary to think that anyone can see what I post.

I heard that a high school banned Myspace. That seems strange. How can the school tell students what they can and cannot do online?

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War. Many people say they were against it from the start, but I don't want to join that group. It's not important anymore. Most people think it was a bad idea, except for the people in the government. They do not want to admit they were wrong. 

Many polls show that most people in the United States, Iraq, and around the world think the war was a mistake. Even many U.S. soldiers in Iraq believe the war was a bad idea and we should leave soon.

The war was a disaster from the start. Leaving will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. The cultures are too different. The U.S. government does not understand this. They think they can bring democracy to a place where it does not belong.

Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought about the problems before invading. It has become a disaster.

I do not know what to say. I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq. The government may have reasons, but I do not agree.  

If they want to leave gradually, over a year or more, that is okay. But I do not see a reason to stay any longer.

Many Iraqis want us to leave. They think we should leave soon. Maybe they know better. If we ask them and they say leave, then it is not our fault if things go wrong. 

We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. 

It affects more than just women. It depends on the type of work. 

Women face challenges because of a "glass ceiling." Even though equality is important, many people find it hard to accept a woman in a higher position. They may have to work under a woman if they are a man.

This is because of how society has always been. In the workplace, women may have the skills for a job, but the board might not promote them because they are women. 

This same thing can happen to men. For example, in fields like fashion or parenting.

It is uncommon for a man to stay home and care for children. People often look down on this because society expects men to work and be the main provider. It can be hard on the man because it might be his dream to stay home. Maybe his wife has the better job and they are happy this way, but society judges them.

In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously if they are straight. 

People might not believe they know about fashion.

In different jobs, there is definitely gender discrimination.

To change this is difficult because society has strong beliefs.  We have made progress since the 1800s, but change is slow. Women are getting into higher positions and becoming CEOs. It is a slow process, but people are starting to accept it.

More men are becoming stay-at-home dads. People are realizing that maybe the wife has the better job or the man wants to be with the children.

In fashion, people are starting to see that men can have a good understanding of fashion too. 

To change things, we need to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped. We can't be too pushy, but we can highlight their strengths. 

We are making progress, but change takes time.

Many people think that marijuana should be legal. They say that it is less harmful than alcohol. They also say that it can help people with certain medical conditions.  Some people say that decriminalizing marijuana is a good first step. It means that people caught with marijuana are not arrested. They just get a ticket, like a traffic violation.

Some people think that decriminalization saves money.

It costs a lot of money to arrest, jail, and prosecute people for marijuana offenses. This money could be used for other things, like education or social programs.

People who support decriminalization say that it is unfair to punish people for using a substance that is less harmful than alcohol.  

However, some people still oppose marijuana legalization. They say that it can be addictive and harmful to people's health. They also worry that it will lead to more people using harder drugs.

There are strong arguments on both sides of this issue. It is a complex problem with no easy solutions.

I think yes.
Because
Many Catholic things are old.
They have done these things for a long time.
It is good to follow old ways.
But, it is also good to change.
Many Catholics go to Church every week.
They are strict about how things are done.
I think the Church judges people who do not follow the rules.
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics.
They do not accept people of other religions.
For example, my father was an Episcopalian.
My mother was Catholic.
They could not marry in the Catholic Church.
This is not being kind to other religions.
We learn to love others. This is a Catholic teaching.
But it is wrong to say love others and not accept them.
The rules say to do things, but the practices go against these things.
They are old and should change.

I do not think this would change things.
I think it is good for priests to marry.
But, I do not think this would stop bad priests.
This is a different problem.
People who hurt children do this no matter what.
Allowing priests to marry would not stop this.

I am not sure what I think about this issue. I cannot say if one side is right or wrong. But I think this is a very hard problem. It is hard to balance the idea of separation of church and state with how to define marriage. I do not know. I think all civil unions should be equal. I do not know if marriage should be defined by the government. 

If marriage is a religious thing, like a baptism, the government should not care. People should not get different tax breaks or treatment from the government based on their religion.

If two people are married, the government should just see it as a civil union. It is two people who are together. The government should not care what kind of marriage it is.

If all the states agree on a law, then they should make it a federal law. But it is wrong to change the Constitution to ban gay marriage. The Constitution should not be changed for something like this. It is important to some people, but not important enough to change the Constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home.  Homosexuality is hard for me to understand. I have gay friends. I do not agree with their way of life.  But, I think they should be allowed to marry.  It should not be a big problem for the country. Each state should decide. 

Many states are Democratic and many are Republican. Democratic states want to allow gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you should respect their decision.

I think gay people should have the same rights as straight people. That is why I support gay marriage, but each state should decide.

I do not think President Bush should say that the whole country should not allow gay marriage.  He lives in one state. He should not tell other states what to do. 

A new president will be elected soon. Maybe a Democratic president will allow gay marriage. It keeps changing back and forth.  States should decide. They live there and have to deal with the decision.

I do not agree. Myspace is open to the public.

If you put something on Myspace, others can see it. This includes school officials. Even if they do not use the school's name, they can access it from home.

If the school sees something on Myspace that could prevent a shooting, they have a right to see it.

Schools have a duty to keep students safe.

If seeing something on Myspace helps them do that, it is okay.

However, I think it is wrong for schools to go on Myspace just to find students doing bad things. 

They should not be spying on students.

But if they see something that could help them keep students safe, it is different.


Everything on the internet is public. 

Students should not expect privacy online. 

If you post something online, it can come back to hurt you later.

Like I said, schools have a duty to keep students safe.

If seeing something on Myspace helps them do that, it is okay.

I supported the war at first. Nine Eleven affected me. I wanted revenge.

But now I am against it. I believe we were unprepared and acted without a plan.

The war did not help. People over there fight with each other. 

We cannot make a difference if they cannot make peace among themselves.

I feel nothing for them. I see them as savage. They fight each other, not for a better future.

They want us to leave. I agree.

We went in blindly. We did not understand their culture or their way of war.

President Bush declared war on Iraq because people wanted it after Nine Eleven.  

We could not ignore the attack. We had to react. But we should have planned better.

There was no clear goal. We lacked unity. 

We went in angry. We created more anger.

We are not the ones to change them. They will always be like this.

We made some progress, but not enough. We should leave. 

Staying only hurts us.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change its views. 
Many people are leaving the Church because its views are old.
The Church does not agree with gay marriage, abortion, or birth control. 
These are important issues today. The Church's views on these things make some people uncomfortable. 
People disagree with the Church on these topics. 
For example, if someone believes in abortion, they may not feel welcome in the Church. The same is true for people who support gay marriage. 
I think priests should be able to marry. Everyone else has a job and a family. 
The Church says priests are married to God, but I think they can be married to a person too.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should be able to marry who they want. I think it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot.  

It does not seem like being gay is a choice. Some people are born gay, just like some people are born straight. I do not think people should be punished for how they feel.

I do not think the government should be involved in who people marry. It is not a legal problem. It is a personal matter. People should be free to love who they want.

Many people believe that gay marriage should be legal. There are good reasons for this. Some people think that gay couples are bad for families. But this is not true. Gay couples are different from straight couples, but that does not mean they are bad. 

It is like having heads and tails. They are different, but both are important.

Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples. They should be able to share property and health care.

Many studies show that gay relationships are just as strong as straight relationships.  Gay couples are happy and want the same things as everyone else. 

Gay people are not asking to get married in a church. They want a legal marriage from the government. The government should not mix religion and law.

Some people say that gay marriage is wrong because of their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Gay couples should be treated the same as straight couples. They should have the right to adopt children. Some people worry about how children of gay couples will be treated. But children of gay couples are just like other children. They deserve love and support.

The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states. President Bush does not support gay marriage because of his religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Some people think that gay people are broken or damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association says that being gay is normal. People should listen to experts, not rumors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I see drugs all the time. Some drugs are illegal, but they can help people.  For example, oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets are illegal but we use them to help patients.

Just because something is illegal does not mean it is bad. Marijuana is illegal, but it can help people too. If we make it legal, people can use it safely and for medicine.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. Both can be bad if you use too much. But marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine.

We need to change how people think about marijuana. It is not a dangerous drug. If people see it as safe, they will use it responsibly.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I always wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there every week. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that is only thirty minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even to church. In summer, people come straight from the beach. The morning masses, where I used to dress up, are more casual now. People wear jeans and khakis.

Regarding the bad things that have happened with priests, I do not think the church could have stopped them. Some married men become pedophiles. It is about the person, not their marriage status. Priests choose to be priests. Other religions allow priests to be married. They could consider a different faith if they want to be married and practice their religion.

I believe pedophilia is a genetic issue. People are born that way. It is not caused by how they are raised. You cannot hide it through marriage.

If the church knew about these problems and covered them up, that is wrong. But I do not think they always knew.

I am not happy about the Iraq War. I think the Bush government lied to the people. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This is not true. 
The Bush government said the Iraq War was about September 11th. They said Saddam Hussein was involved. This is not true either.
Colin Powell, who led the presentation at the United Nations, now says he did not believe the evidence then. This is wrong. Lying to the people is a very serious problem. 

I think the Bush government does not care about the Constitution. They want more power. They wanted to go to war from the start.
Someone in the Bush government said this in a book after he left office. They wanted to fight Saddam Hussein because of his father. They also wanted to control more oil.

The Iraq War has gone on for too long. Leaving now could cause a civil war. More people would die. The United Nations and the United States are working with other countries to help Iraq. This may not be a good idea. Iraq will have less power.
The Iraqi government is weak. The Parliament does not work well. The Prime Minister has no control.  

Bad people still fight in Iraq. They want power. This makes the situation very complex.

I feel it is not a good idea for the war to continue. It is not a real war because Congress did not say it was. 

I think the main reason we are there is to show that America is strong. We have big guns and we are willing to use them.

But I do not think it is right to stay there and try to make Iraq like America. Iraq has its own culture. We should not try to change them.

Staying there is wasting our money and time. It is hurting the people in Iraq and it is making America look bad.

Many families have loved ones in Iraq. I understand why they want the war to end. But staying there is not the answer.

I think this war will go on for a long time. It is a bad situation.

I do not think it is right to make this act legal. I do not think a state should say it is legal. I think it is up to the churches. The Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear.

Trying to change this would go against what is already in the Constitution. If the government tries to make this act illegal, it would mean they are choosing one church's beliefs over another. Most Catholics and Christians are against this. 

The government should not tell churches what they can and cannot say is illegal or legal.  

Separation of church and state is important for religious freedom in the United States. Even though there was talk of an amendment, I think this would be wrong. It would go against what the Constitution already says. It would be one of the few amendments that restrict people instead of the government.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. I do not understand why someone would want to change the law. This person's reason for wanting an amendment is that it goes against his own beliefs as a Catholic.  He is choosing one religion over others. 

It is up to the churches to decide, not the president or the government. There is no good reason to have an amendment banning this. It will not affect the economy or anything else.

The war in Iraq is a difficult issue. I do not think the government was truthful with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before the invasion, the government tried to connect the war to the terrorist attacks on September 11th, 2001.  This made it seem like the two events were related, but they were not. The government used people's fear and anger after the attacks to start the war in 2003.

I am against war, especially when a country attacks first. The war in Iraq reminds me of the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes. Many American soldiers died in Iraq, and it is very sad.

The United States removed the Iraqi government and tried to create a democracy. This is similar to what happened in Vietnam, where the United States tried to remove Communists and support democracy. This is a very hard process. The government should have known it would be long and difficult.

The war in Iraq is not a clear victory.  No matter how many people support the United States, there will always be people who resist. It is hard to defeat people who are fighting in their own country.

The government should have planned better for what would happen after the war.  They were not prepared for the chaos and instability. We are still there today, almost at the end of 2006, and many American troops are still dying. 

The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful. It is not like that. It takes many years to build a new government and make it work. Our own country had a long struggle to become a democracy.

It is hard to decide what to do now. We have been there for so long. Can we just leave?  But many people in Iraq need our help.

The war has cost a lot of American lives. How much is too much to risk for a free Iraq?

Why are we only going to war in Iraq? Why not in other countries that need help? I think the real reason is oil. The United States needs oil, and Iraq has it.

Another reason for the war was that we thought Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. We never found them. But countries like North Korea have weapons of mass destruction, and we are not attacking them. I do not think the government is being honest.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it is a personal choice. Science shows it can be part of a person's nature, not just a choice they make. To deny people rights because of this is unfair.

I think the government should not decide who can marry. It is a personal matter between two people. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk their dogs and live their lives. 

I think it is wrong for the government to try to control who people love. Marriage is a personal choice.

I have read that being gay may be partly due to biology. It could be something a person is born with. This is different from things like family size or upbringing.

It seems unfair that gay couples face so much attention when they want to marry. Straight couples can marry privately, but gay couples' marriages are often in the news. Marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

The internet is open. Anything you put on it, people can see. As an RA, I have seen this. If you post about bad things, people will make judgments. If you talk about hurting people, someone will tell the school.

The school must act. They can't ignore a threat. But it's hard to know if something is a joke or serious.

In my school, a rumor started. Someone heard a student talk about bad things. The school found out who it was and looked at their Facebook. Some things on the page were worrisome. 

The student may have meant it as a joke, but it was serious in light of the rumor.

The internet is public. If you don't want people to see it, don't post it. You can't control how people react.

School officials shouldn't be friends with students on social media. That is wrong. 

But if a student tells the school about something concerning, the school has to act. They can't ignore it.

I think schools should not check phones, texts, or instant messages without a reason. It's a personal thing.

I think this war has gone on too long. At first, the goal was good. It was to help another country have democracy. But now I think we have lost sight of that goal. Maybe we are just fighting to show that we are strong. 

I also think the reason for the war may not have been fair. 
George Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein before.

If the goal was to help a country that did not have fair elections, then that is a good reason to fight. 

But I think the reason for the war has changed. It seems like we are fighting just to keep fighting.

I think we showed our strength in the first few months of the war. 

But the war has gone on for many years. I think it should end.

At some point, the other country will have to take care of itself. We have spent a lot of money on this war. We have problems here at home, like poverty. We should spend our money on these problems. 

We spend billions of dollars on the war. We need money for things like schools, roads, and healthcare.

We should not spend so much money on war.

I want to ask a question. Can someone tell me why someone's Myspace page was blocked?

It seems good that someone saw the information and stopped something bad from happening.  

But it is hard to know if it was right to look at someone's profile like that. Should someone be watching everyone's profiles to keep them safe? That seems unfair.

I use Facebook. I worry that bad people can see things about me. I saw a news story about a man who got a girl's information from her profile and talked to her. That is scary.

People can find a lot about you on Facebook. They can see your pictures, your friends, and even your schedule. It is hard to know how much to share.

I only accept friends I know. But it is still scary to think that anyone can see what I post.

I heard that a high school banned Myspace. That seems strange. How can the school tell students what they can and cannot do online?

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War. Many people say they were against it from the start, but I don't want to join that group. It's not important anymore. Most people think it was a bad idea, except for the people in the government. They do not want to admit they were wrong. 

Many polls show that most people in the United States, Iraq, and around the world think the war was a mistake. Even many U.S. soldiers in Iraq believe the war was a bad idea and we should leave soon.

The war was a disaster from the start. Leaving will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. The cultures are too different. The U.S. government does not understand this. They think they can bring democracy to a place where it does not belong.

Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought about the problems before invading. It has become a disaster.

I do not know what to say. I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq. The government may have reasons, but I do not agree.  

If they want to leave gradually, over a year or more, that is okay. But I do not see a reason to stay any longer.

Many Iraqis want us to leave. They think we should leave soon. Maybe they know better. If we ask them and they say leave, then it is not our fault if things go wrong. 

We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. 

It affects more than just women. It depends on the type of work. 

Women face challenges because of a "glass ceiling." Even though equality is important, many people find it hard to accept a woman in a higher position. They may have to work under a woman if they are a man.

This is because of how society has always been. In the workplace, women may have the skills for a job, but the board might not promote them because they are women. 

This same thing can happen to men. For example, in fields like fashion or parenting.

It is uncommon for a man to stay home and care for children. People often look down on this because society expects men to work and be the main provider. It can be hard on the man because it might be his dream to stay home. Maybe his wife has the better job and they are happy this way, but society judges them.

In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously if they are straight. 

People might not believe they know about fashion.

In different jobs, there is definitely gender discrimination.

To change this is difficult because society has strong beliefs.  We have made progress since the 1800s, but change is slow. Women are getting into higher positions and becoming CEOs. It is a slow process, but people are starting to accept it.

More men are becoming stay-at-home dads. People are realizing that maybe the wife has the better job or the man wants to be with the children.

In fashion, people are starting to see that men can have a good understanding of fashion too. 

To change things, we need to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped. We can't be too pushy, but we can highlight their strengths. 

We are making progress, but change takes time.

Many people think that marijuana should be legal. They say that it is less harmful than alcohol. They also say that it can help people with certain medical conditions.  Some people say that decriminalizing marijuana is a good first step. It means that people caught with marijuana are not arrested. They just get a ticket, like a traffic violation.

Some people think that decriminalization saves money.

It costs a lot of money to arrest, jail, and prosecute people for marijuana offenses. This money could be used for other things, like education or social programs.

People who support decriminalization say that it is unfair to punish people for using a substance that is less harmful than alcohol.  

However, some people still oppose marijuana legalization. They say that it can be addictive and harmful to people's health. They also worry that it will lead to more people using harder drugs.

There are strong arguments on both sides of this issue. It is a complex problem with no easy solutions.

I think yes.
Because
Many Catholic things are old.
They have done these things for a long time.
It is good to follow old ways.
But, it is also good to change.
Many Catholics go to Church every week.
They are strict about how things are done.
I think the Church judges people who do not follow the rules.
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics.
They do not accept people of other religions.
For example, my father was an Episcopalian.
My mother was Catholic.
They could not marry in the Catholic Church.
This is not being kind to other religions.
We learn to love others. This is a Catholic teaching.
But it is wrong to say love others and not accept them.
The rules say to do things, but the practices go against these things.
They are old and should change.

I do not think this would change things.
I think it is good for priests to marry.
But, I do not think this would stop bad priests.
This is a different problem.
People who hurt children do this no matter what.
Allowing priests to marry would not stop this.

I am not sure what I think about this issue. I cannot say if one side is right or wrong. But I think this is a very hard problem. It is hard to balance the idea of separation of church and state with how to define marriage. I do not know. I think all civil unions should be equal. I do not know if marriage should be defined by the government. 

If marriage is a religious thing, like a baptism, the government should not care. People should not get different tax breaks or treatment from the government based on their religion.

If two people are married, the government should just see it as a civil union. It is two people who are together. The government should not care what kind of marriage it is.

If all the states agree on a law, then they should make it a federal law. But it is wrong to change the Constitution to ban gay marriage. The Constitution should not be changed for something like this. It is important to some people, but not important enough to change the Constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home.  Homosexuality is hard for me to understand. I have gay friends. I do not agree with their way of life.  But, I think they should be allowed to marry.  It should not be a big problem for the country. Each state should decide. 

Many states are Democratic and many are Republican. Democratic states want to allow gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you should respect their decision.

I think gay people should have the same rights as straight people. That is why I support gay marriage, but each state should decide.

I do not think President Bush should say that the whole country should not allow gay marriage.  He lives in one state. He should not tell other states what to do. 

A new president will be elected soon. Maybe a Democratic president will allow gay marriage. It keeps changing back and forth.  States should decide. They live there and have to deal with the decision.

I do not agree. Myspace is open to the public.

If you put something on Myspace, others can see it. This includes school officials. Even if they do not use the school's name, they can access it from home.

If the school sees something on Myspace that could prevent a shooting, they have a right to see it.

Schools have a duty to keep students safe.

If seeing something on Myspace helps them do that, it is okay.

However, I think it is wrong for schools to go on Myspace just to find students doing bad things. 

They should not be spying on students.

But if they see something that could help them keep students safe, it is different.


Everything on the internet is public. 

Students should not expect privacy online. 

If you post something online, it can come back to hurt you later.

Like I said, schools have a duty to keep students safe.

If seeing something on Myspace helps them do that, it is okay.

I supported the war at first. Nine Eleven affected me. I wanted revenge.

But now I am against it. I believe we were unprepared and acted without a plan.

The war did not help. People over there fight with each other. 

We cannot make a difference if they cannot make peace among themselves.

I feel nothing for them. I see them as savage. They fight each other, not for a better future.

They want us to leave. I agree.

We went in blindly. We did not understand their culture or their way of war.

President Bush declared war on Iraq because people wanted it after Nine Eleven.  

We could not ignore the attack. We had to react. But we should have planned better.

There was no clear goal. We lacked unity. 

We went in angry. We created more anger.

We are not the ones to change them. They will always be like this.

We made some progress, but not enough. We should leave. 

Staying only hurts us.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change its views. 
Many people are leaving the Church because its views are old.
The Church does not agree with gay marriage, abortion, or birth control. 
These are important issues today. The Church's views on these things make some people uncomfortable. 
People disagree with the Church on these topics. 
For example, if someone believes in abortion, they may not feel welcome in the Church. The same is true for people who support gay marriage. 
I think priests should be able to marry. Everyone else has a job and a family. 
The Church says priests are married to God, but I think they can be married to a person too.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should be able to marry who they want. I think it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can marry but two people of the same sex cannot.  

It does not seem like being gay is a choice. Some people are born gay, just like some people are born straight. I do not think people should be punished for how they feel.

I do not think the government should be involved in who people marry. It is not a legal problem. It is a personal matter. People should be free to love who they want.

Many people believe that gay marriage should be legal. There are good reasons for this. Some people think that gay couples are bad for families. But this is not true. Gay couples are different from straight couples, but that does not mean they are bad. 

It is like having heads and tails. They are different, but both are important.

Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples. They should be able to share property and health care.

Many studies show that gay relationships are just as strong as straight relationships.  Gay couples are happy and want the same things as everyone else. 

Gay people are not asking to get married in a church. They want a legal marriage from the government. The government should not mix religion and law.

Some people say that gay marriage is wrong because of their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Gay couples should be treated the same as straight couples. They should have the right to adopt children. Some people worry about how children of gay couples will be treated. But children of gay couples are just like other children. They deserve love and support.

The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states. President Bush does not support gay marriage because of his religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Some people think that gay people are broken or damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association says that being gay is normal. People should listen to experts, not rumors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I see drugs all the time. Some drugs are illegal, but they can help people.  For example, oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets are illegal but we use them to help patients.

Just because something is illegal does not mean it is bad. Marijuana is illegal, but it can help people too. If we make it legal, people can use it safely and for medicine.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. Both can be bad if you use too much. But marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine.

We need to change how people think about marijuana. It is not a dangerous drug. If people see it as safe, they will use it responsibly.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I always wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there every week. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that is only thirty minutes long. People wear casual clothes, even to church. In summer, people come straight from the beach. The morning masses, where I used to dress up, are more casual now. People wear jeans and khakis.

Regarding the bad things that have happened with priests, I do not think the church could have stopped them. Some married men become pedophiles. It is about the person, not their marriage status. Priests choose to be priests. Other religions allow priests to be married. They could consider a different faith if they want to be married and practice their religion.

I believe pedophilia is a genetic issue. People are born that way. It is not caused by how they are raised. You cannot hide it through marriage.

If the church knew about these problems and covered them up, that is wrong. But I do not think they always knew.

I am not happy about the Iraq War. I think the Bush government lied to the people. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This is not true. 
The Bush government said the Iraq War was about September 11th. They said Saddam Hussein was involved. This is not true either.
Colin Powell, who led the presentation at the United Nations, now says he did not believe the evidence then. This is wrong. Lying to the people is a very serious problem. 

I think the Bush government does not care about the Constitution. They want more power. They wanted to go to war from the start.
Someone in the Bush government said this in a book after he left office. They wanted to fight Saddam Hussein because of his father. They also wanted to control more oil.

The Iraq War has gone on for too long. Leaving now could cause a civil war. More people would die. The United Nations and the United States are working with other countries to help Iraq. This may not be a good idea. Iraq will have less power.
The Iraqi government is weak. The Parliament does not work well. The Prime Minister has no control.  

Bad people still fight in Iraq. They want power. This makes the situation very complex.

I feel it is not a good idea for the war to continue. It is not a real war because Congress did not say it was. 

I think the main reason we are there is to show that America is strong. We have big guns and we are willing to use them.

But I do not think it is right to stay there and try to make Iraq like America. Iraq has its own culture. We should not try to change them.

Staying there is wasting our money and time. It is hurting the people in Iraq and it is making America look bad.

Many families have loved ones in Iraq. I understand why they want the war to end. But staying there is not the answer.

I think this war will go on for a long time. It is a bad situation.

I do not think it is right to make this act legal. I do not think a state should say it is legal. I think it is up to the churches. The Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear.

Trying to change this would go against what is already in the Constitution. If the government tries to make this act illegal, it would mean they are choosing one church's beliefs over another. Most Catholics and Christians are against this. 

The government should not tell churches what they can and cannot say is illegal or legal.  

Separation of church and state is important for religious freedom in the United States. Even though there was talk of an amendment, I think this would be wrong. It would go against what the Constitution already says. It would be one of the few amendments that restrict people instead of the government.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. I do not understand why someone would want to change the law. This person's reason for wanting an amendment is that it goes against his own beliefs as a Catholic.  He is choosing one religion over others. 

It is up to the churches to decide, not the president or the government. There is no good reason to have an amendment banning this. It will not affect the economy or anything else.

The war in Iraq is a difficult issue. I do not think the government was truthful with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before the invasion, the government tried to connect the war to the terrorist attacks on September 11th, 2001.  This made it seem like the two events were related, but they were not. The government used people's fear and anger after the attacks to start the war in 2003.

I am against war, especially when a country attacks first. The war in Iraq reminds me of the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes. Many American soldiers died in Iraq, and it is very sad.

The United States removed the Iraqi government and tried to create a democracy. This is similar to what happened in Vietnam, where the United States tried to remove Communists and support democracy. This is a very hard process. The government should have known it would be long and difficult.

The war in Iraq is not a clear victory.  No matter how many people support the United States, there will always be people who resist. It is hard to defeat people who are fighting in their own country.

The government should have planned better for what would happen after the war.  They were not prepared for the chaos and instability. We are still there today, almost at the end of 2006, and many American troops are still dying. 

The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful. It is not like that. It takes many years to build a new government and make it work. Our own country had a long struggle to become a democracy.

It is hard to decide what to do now. We have been there for so long. Can we just leave?  But many people in Iraq need our help.

The war has cost a lot of American lives. How much is too much to risk for a free Iraq?

Why are we only going to war in Iraq? Why not in other countries that need help? I think the real reason is oil. The United States needs oil, and Iraq has it.

Another reason for the war was that we thought Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. We never found them. But countries like North Korea have weapons of mass destruction, and we are not attacking them. I do not think the government is being honest.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it is a personal choice. Science shows it can be part of a person's nature, not just a choice they make. To deny people rights because of this is unfair.

I think the government should not decide who can marry. It is a personal matter between two people. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk their dogs and live their lives. 

I think it is wrong for the government to try to control who people love. Marriage is a personal choice.

I have read that being gay may be partly due to biology. It could be something a person is born with. This is different from things like family size or upbringing.

It seems unfair that gay couples face so much attention when they want to marry. Straight couples can marry privately, but gay couples' marriages are often in the news. Marriage should be a private matter, not a public one.

The internet is open. Anything you put on it, people can see. As an RA, I have seen this. If you post about bad things, people will make judgments. If you talk about hurting people, someone will tell the school.

The school must act. They can't ignore a threat. But it's hard to know if something is a joke or serious.

In my school, a rumor started. Someone heard a student talk about bad things. The school found out who it was and looked at their Facebook. Some things on the page were worrisome. 

The student may have meant it as a joke, but it was serious in light of the rumor.

The internet is public. If you don't want people to see it, don't post it. You can't control how people react.

School officials shouldn't be friends with students on social media. That is wrong. 

But if a student tells the school about something concerning, the school has to act. They can't ignore it.

I think schools should not check phones, texts, or instant messages without a reason. It's a personal thing.

I think this war has gone on too long. At first, the goal was good. It was to help another country have democracy. But now I think we have lost sight of that goal. Maybe we are just fighting to show that we are strong. 

I also think the reason for the war may not have been fair. 
George Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein before.

If the goal was to help a country that did not have fair elections, then that is a good reason to fight. 

But I think the reason for the war has changed. It seems like we are fighting just to keep fighting.

I think we showed our strength in the first few months of the war. 

But the war has gone on for many years. I think it should end.

At some point, the other country will have to take care of itself. We have spent a lot of money on this war. We have problems here at home, like poverty. We should spend our money on these problems. 

We spend billions of dollars on the war. We need money for things like schools, roads, and healthcare.

We should not spend so much money on war.

I want to ask a question. Can someone tell me why someone's Myspace page was blocked?

It seems good that someone saw the information and stopped something bad from happening.  

But it is hard to know if it was right to look at someone's profile like that. Should someone be watching everyone's profiles to keep them safe? That seems unfair.

I use Facebook. I worry that bad people can see things about me. I saw a news story about a man who got a girl's information from her profile and talked to her. That is scary.

People can find a lot about you on Facebook. They can see your pictures, your friends, and even your schedule. It is hard to know how much to share.

I only accept friends I know. But it is still scary to think that anyone can see what I post.

I heard that a high school banned Myspace. That seems strange. How can the school tell students what they can and cannot do online?

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War. Many people say they were against it from the start, but I don't want to join that group. It's not important anymore. Most people think it was a bad idea, except for the people in the government. They do not want to admit they were wrong. 

Many polls show that most people in the United States, Iraq, and around the world think the war was a mistake. Even many U.S. soldiers in Iraq believe the war was a bad idea and we should leave soon.

The war was a disaster from the start. Leaving will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. The cultures are too different. The U.S. government does not understand this. They think they can bring democracy to a place where it does not belong.

Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought about the problems before invading. It has become a disaster.

I do not know what to say. I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq. The government may have reasons, but I do not agree.  

If they want to leave gradually, over a year or more, that is okay. But I do not see a reason to stay any longer.

Many Iraqis want us to leave. They think we should leave soon. Maybe they know better. If we ask them and they say leave, then it is not our fault if things go wrong. 

We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. 

It affects more than just women. It depends on the type of work. 

Women face challenges because of a "glass ceiling." Even though equality is important, many people find it hard to accept a woman in a higher position. They may have to work under a woman if they are a man.

This is because of how society has always been. In the workplace, women may have the skills for a job, but the board might not promote them because they are women. 

This same thing can happen to men. For example, in fields like fashion or parenting.

It is uncommon for a man to stay home and care for children. People often look down on this because society expects men to work and be the main provider. It can be hard on the man because it might be his dream to stay home. Maybe his wife has the better job and they are happy this way, but society judges them.

In the fashion industry, men may not be taken seriously if they are straight. 

People might not believe they know about fashion.

In different jobs, there is definitely gender discrimination.

To change this is difficult because society has strong beliefs.  We have made progress since the 1800s, but change is slow. Women are getting into higher positions and becoming CEOs. It is a slow process, but people are starting to accept it.

More men are becoming stay-at-home dads. People are realizing that maybe the wife has the better job or the man wants to be with the children.

In fashion, people are starting to see that men can have a good understanding of fashion too. 

To change things, we need to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped. We can't be too pushy, but we can highlight their strengths. 

We are making progress, but change takes time.

Many people think that marijuana should be legal. They say that it is less harmful than alcohol. They also say that it can help people with certain medical conditions.  Some people say that decriminalizing marijuana is a good first step. It means that people caught with marijuana are not arrested. They just get a ticket, like a traffic violation.

Some people think that decriminalization saves money.

It costs a lot of money to arrest, jail, and prosecute people for marijuana offenses. This money could be used for other things, like education or social programs.

People who support decriminalization say that it is unfair to punish people for using a substance that is less harmful than alcohol.  

However, some people still oppose marijuana legalization. They say that it can be addictive and harmful to people's health. They also worry that it will lead to more people using harder drugs.

There are strong arguments on both sides of this issue. It is a complex problem with no easy solutions.

I think yes.
Because
Many Catholic things are old.
They have done these things for a long time.
It is good to follow old ways.
But, it is also good to change.
Many Catholics go to Church every week.
They are strict about how things are done.
I think the Church judges people who do not follow the rules.
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics.
They do not accept people of other religions.
For example, my father was an Episcopalian.
My mother was Catholic.
They could not marry in the Catholic Church.
This is not being kind to other religions.
We learn to love others. This is a Catholic teaching.
But it is wrong to say love others and not accept them.
The rules say to do things, but the practices go against these things.
They are old and should change.

I do not think this would change things.
I think it is good for priests to marry.
But, I do not think this would stop bad priests.

People who hurt children do this no matter what.

I am not sure what I think about this issue. I cannot say if one side is right or wrong. But I think this is a very hard problem. It is hard to balance the idea of separation of church and state with how to define marriage. I do not know. I think all civil unions should be equal. I do not know if marriage should be defined by the government. 

If marriage is a religious thing, like a baptism, the government should not care. People should not get different tax breaks or treatment from the government based on their religion.

If two people are married, the government should just see it as a civil union. It is two people who are together. The government should not care what kind of marriage it is.

If all the states agree on a law, then they should make it a federal law. But it is wrong to change the Constitution to ban gay marriage. The Constitution should not be changed for something like this. It is important to some people, but not important enough to change the Constitution.

I grew up in a Christian home.  Homosexuality is hard for me to understand. I have gay friends. I do not agree with their way of life.  But, I think they should be allowed to marry.  It should not be a big problem for the country. Each state should decide. 

Many states are Democratic and many are Republican. Democratic states want to allow gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you should respect their decision.

I think gay people should have the same rights as straight people. That is why I support gay marriage, but each state should decide.

I do not think President Bush should say that the whole country should not allow gay marriage.  He lives in one state. He should not tell other states what to do. 

A new president will be elected soon. Maybe a Democratic president will allow gay marriage. It keeps changing back and forth.  States should decide. They live there and have to deal with the decision.

I do not agree. Myspace is open to the public.

If you put something on Myspace, others can see it. This includes school officials. Even if they do not use the school's name, they can access it from home.

If the school sees something on Myspace that could prevent a shooting, they have a right to see it.

Schools have a duty to keep students safe.

If seeing something on Myspace helps them do that, it is okay.

However, I think it is wrong for schools to go on Myspace just to find students doing bad things. 

They should not be spying on students.

But if they see something that could help them keep students safe, it is different.


Everything on the internet is public. 

Students should not expect privacy online. 

If you post something online, it can come back to hurt you later.

Like I said, schools have a duty to keep students safe.

If seeing something on Myspace helps them do that, it is okay.

I supported the war at first. Nine Eleven affected me. I wanted revenge.

But now I am against it. I believe we were unprepared and acted without a plan.

The war did not help. People over there fight with each other. 

We cannot make a difference if they cannot make peace among themselves.

I feel nothing for them. I see them as savage. They fight each other, not for a better future.

They want us to leave. I agree.

We went in blindly. We did not understand their culture or their way of war.

President Bush declared war on Iraq because people wanted it after Nine Eleven.  

We could not ignore the attack. We had to react. But we should have planned better.

There was no clear goal. We lacked unity. 

We went in angry. We created more anger.

We are not the ones to change them. They will always be like this.

We made some progress, but not enough. We should leave. 

Staying only hurts us.
